alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Eastern Ascension; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central St. John The Baptist, southeastern Ascension, northeastern St. James, north central St. Charles, southeastern St. Helena, northwestern St. Tammany, eastern Livingston, Tangipahoa, northwestern Jefferson and western Washington Parishes through 715 AM CDT... At 645 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Montpelier to near Independence to near Springfield to near Whitehall to Sorrento. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Covington, Franklinton, Reserve, Amite, Laplace, Ponchatoula, Amite City, Lutcher, Abita Springs, Independence, Sorrento, Roseland, Albany, Madisonville, Folsom, Springfield, Montpelier, Enon and Garyville. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 182 and 218. Interstate 12 between mile markers 30 and 66. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Eastern Ascension; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington; Western Ascension
